channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2022 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Russia detains at least 4,640 people on Sunday during protests, says independent monitoring group
Police brutally beat anti-war protesters in St. Petersburg, Russia
'I'm worried': Rubio says West's misunderstanding of Putin's mindset is dangerous
item.description: Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) tells CNN's Jake Tapper that the West's response to Vladimir Putin demonstrates a misunderstanding of the Russian president and puts the West in a dangerous position.

item.title: Stocks sink while oil soars after US and allies consider banning Russian oil
item.description: Stocks are tumbling Monday as oil prices are soaring to the highest level in 13 years, raising fears about a further spike in inflation that could damage the global economy.

item.title: Analysis: Ukrainians are giving two lessons in democracy that Americans have forgotten
Opinion: Why Vladimir Putin will regret launching this war
item.description: Has Vladimir Putin's assault on Ukraine outrun the resources he's committed to it? That's the view of retired US Army Major General Mike Repass, who has an informed vantage point on the conflict, having worked in the Ukrainian security sector since 2016. The former commander of the US Special Operations Command in Europe, Repass provides education and advisory support to the Ukrainian military on a US government contract.

item.title: People are booking Airbnbs in Ukraine. They don't plan to check in
item.description: Volodymyr Bondarenko spends most of his day holed up in his apartment in the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv.

item.title: Despite Russia's restrictions on the press, 'time is on the side of liberty,' Radio Free Europe CEO says
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: 4 ways the world is different since Russia invaded Ukraine
item.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has taken hundreds of lives on the battlefield and in the Ukrainian cities under bombardment. But internationally, it's also affecting everything from food security in Cairo to gas prices in California. It's pushed to the fore major geopolitical shifts and changed the way some of the globe's most prominent institutions work.

item.title: Russia has fired 600 missiles since its invasion began, a US official says. Ukrainians are protesting in multiple areas where Russian troops have arrived.
item.description: Full coverage: The latest in Ukraine | Help Ukrainians | CNN lite site

item.title: 'A family died... in front of my eyes': Civilians killed as Russian military strike hits evacuation route in Kyiv
item.description: Civilians in the battered Ukrainian port city of Mariupol are trapped without power and water and unable to recover their dead, its mayor said Saturday, as he accused Russia of trying to "choke" the city by shutting off agreed evacuation routes.

item.title: 'Brutal reality': Video shows missiles flying overhead of Ukrainians
'Get out of our land': Ukrainians band together and harangue armed Russian soldiers
item.description: While the Ukrainian military's resistance against Russia's invasion has been well-documented, the last few days have seen growing popular defiance of Russian forces. In the south of Ukraine, especially, there have been multiple protests in areas where Russian troops have arrived.

item.title: Analysis: Trump has been on Putin's side
Opinion: The voices who warned us about Vladimir Putin
item.description: As a commander of US Army troops that defeated the Nazi regime in Germany 77 years ago, Gen. Omar Bradley knew a lot about war. Three years after the Second World War ended, he warned, "The world has achieved brilliance without wisdom, power without conscience. Ours is a world of nuclear giants and ethical infants. We know more about war than we know about peace, more about killing than we know about living."

item.title: Financial impact: Oil price surges to highest since 2008 on delays in Iranian talks
item.description: Oil prices soared to their highest since 2008 due to delays in the potential return of Iranian crude to global markets and as the United States and European allies consider banning imports of Russian oil.

item.title: Addressing Russia: 3 areas where US may take action soon
item.description: American officials on Sunday identified three areas on which the United States could soon take action in an attempt to address Russia's intensifying war in Ukraine: a ban on Russian oil imports, a declaration of war crimes against Russia and help facilitating delivery of Polish fighter jets to Ukraine.

item.title: Warning: GOP lawmaker says 'crazy' Putin will not go quietly
item.description: Rep. Adam Kinzinger (R-IL) speaks with Anderson Cooper about his support of establishing a no-fly zone in Ukraine.

item.title: At a secret airfield in Eastern Europe, a multinational effort to send weapons to Ukraine proceeds at high speed
'You betray me': Ukrainian's message to former Russian friends
Fort Lauderdale police chief fired over minority-first practices in hiring and promotions, report says
item.description: The city of Fort Lauderdale has fired its police chief Larry Scirotto, who has been in office for less than a year, following allegations of discriminatory practices for promotions.

item.title: Man travels 5000 miles to play his piano for Ukrainian refugees
item.description: CNN's Sara Sidner speaks with Davide Martello, a German man who traveled to the Ukrainian-Polish border with his piano to bring peace and hope to Ukrainian refugees through his music.

item.title: Trucker convoy laps Washington, DC, beltway to protest Covid-19 measures
item.description: A convoy of vehicles lapped the Washington, DC, beltway Sunday morning to demand an end to Covid-19 mandates and restrictions.

item.title: See dad's quick thinking as car drives through doughnut shop window
item.description: A dad pulled his son out of danger in the nick of time as a car drove through the window of a doughnut store in Aurora, Colorado. CNN affiliate KCNC reports.

item.title: Tornadoes kill 7, including 2 children, near Des Moines, Iowa, officials say
item.description: Six people -- including two children -- died in a tornado near Des Moines, Iowa, Saturday, officials said.

item.title: Baldwin: 'Rust' lawsuits are going after rich people
item.description: Alec Baldwin appeared on stage at a film festival and talked about the ongoing lawsuits after the fatal shooting on the "Rust" set as well as what he thinks will happen to live weapons in Hollywood.

item.title: 6 Brilliant Ways To Grow Your Wealth In 2022
Dems set up clash with GOP by pairing Covid relief with Ukraine aid
item.description: Democrats and Republicans on Capitol Hill are set for a showdown over Covid-19 relief that threatens to hold up desperately needed aid to Ukraine as the country fights back against Russia's invasion.

item.title: Prosecutors resigned after NY DA said he wasn't prepared to move forward with indictment of Trump
item.description: Two top prosecutors leading the criminal investigation into former President Donald Trump and his business resigned after the Manhattan district attorney said he was not prepared to authorize an indictment against the former President, a person familiar with the investigation said.

item.title: Rep. Paul Gosar's lengthy ties to White nationalists, pro-Nazi blogger and far-right fringe received little pushback for years
item.description: Last spring, Republican Rep. Paul Gosar and a small group of volunteers traveled to the southern border city of San Luis, Arizona, to clean up the city's trash.

item.title: Opinion: Trump must think Russia's invasion of Ukraine is a joke
item.description: Before he entered politics, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky was a professional comedian. Former US President Donald Trump, on the other hand, just plays a bad one at GOP gatherings.

item.title: Hear how Trump reacted when Barr told him election claims were 'bullsh**t'
item.description: Former Attorney General Bill Barr reveals to NBC News just what happened when he told then President Donald Trump that he couldn't push lies about the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Harris calls for voting rights legislation before walking across Edmund Pettus Bridge on Bloody Sunday anniversary
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris will travel to Selma, Alabama, on Sunday, where she will walk across the Edmund Pettus Bridge to mark the 57th anniversary of Bloody Sunday, a key moment in the civil rights moment.

item.title: Opinion: Mike Pence is no profile in courage
item.description: Gearing up for what appears to be a run for president in 2024, former Vice President Mike Pence is seeking to put some daylight between him and his former boss. In a speech to Republican donors on Friday, Pence declared, "There is no room in this party for apologists for (Russian President Vladimir) Putin. There is only room for champions of freedom."

item.title: Podcast: Anthony Bourdain travels to Jamaica, visiting the home of James Bond author Ian Fleming and learning about music legend Bob Marley
Sting posts video of himself singing his 1985 song 'Russians' amid war in Ukraine
'SNL' kicks off with a Fox 'Ukrainian Invasion Celebration Spectacular'
item.description: "Saturday Night Live" kicked off this week's episode with a Fox News "Ukrainian Invasion Celebration Spectacular," hosted by Laura Ingraham, who was played by Kate McKinnon, and Tucker Carlson, who was played by Alex Moffat.

item.title: 'SNL': Famous actor shares clips from his first movie, which he made when he was ten
item.description: First time "Saturday Night Live" host Oscar Isaac shared clips from his first movie, which he made when he was ten.

item.title: Chelsea manager condemns Roman Abramovich chant during tribute to Ukraine
Best Buy founder: What every US college should teach their students
item.description: The value of a college education has come under scrutiny in recent years. With average student debt in the US rising to more than $37,000 in recent estimates, more students are wondering if it is a choice they can afford. And as more affordable online programs become increasingly available, others question whether the "traditional" college experience is relevant anymore.

item.title: Bull rider gets bucked off. His father's next move went viral
item.description: Footage shows 18-year-old Cody Hooks being bucked off the bull at a rodeo in Texas. His father quickly runs out to shield his son as the bull charges toward them.

item.title: What to expect at Apple's first product event of the year
item.description: Apple is about to hold its first big product event of 2022 and the focus will be on performance. That likely means faster chips, more devices with 5G connectivity and more powerful cameras.

item.title: Gas hits $4 a gallon for the first time since 2008
item.description: The average price for a gallon of regular gas hit $4 Sunday, the highest level since 2008. And with prices surging amid Russia's attack on Ukraine, the record high of $4.11 per gallon set that year is likely to fall any day.

item.title: Stoli vodka announces rebrand
item.description: The maker of Stolichnaya vodka announced a major rebrand Friday, in direct response to its founder's "vehement position" against the Putin regime and the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: This 100-year-old NYC icon has the word 'Russian' in its name. Here's how business is going
item.description: The Russian Tea Room is a 100-year-old New York City icon that has long drawn in locals and tourists alike. In its heyday, the restaurant hosted such luminaries as choreographer George Balanchine, artist Salvador Dali and composer Leonard Bernstein, and it was featured in the movies "Tootsie" and "Manhattan."

item.title: Is an Ooni pizza oven worth it? We tested 9 pizza ovens to find the best
Yeti released new colors and they're just what you need for the spring
We spent February testing dozens of products: Here are 22 we loved
We tested the top four tax programs. This was our favorite one
Allbirds just launched new activewear that's as fantastic as its shoes
Don't waste your FSA dollars: Here are 37 genius ways to spend them
How to get pet hair off of literally everything, according to experts
These 5 pressure cookers are actually worth your money
A matching sweatsuit is a wardrobe must-have. Here are 14 we love
It's 2022, you should own a printer: This is our favorite
Just 38 items that will make you happy in 2022
Do you have one of the 10 best credit cards of March 2022?
Trump's stance on Russia haunts GOP
item.description: As Russia wreaks havoc on Ukraine and international stability through its ruthless military campaign, it can be difficult to understand the impact Russia's aggression is having on domestic politics here in the US.

item.title: Putin made Russian athletes his political tools. Banning them is the right thing to do
item.description: In his address to members of the International Olympic Committee before the Beijing Winter Games, IOC President Thomas Bach asserted that the mission of the Olympics was to bring the world together in peaceful competition. "We can only accomplish this mission," Bach stated, "if the Olympic Games stand above and beyond all political differences."

item.title: Putin, the emperor with no clothes
item.description: Has Vladimir Putin gone mad? How else could the Russian President have so recklessly placed the world on the precipice of the unthinkable, with what outside the Kremlin is seen as an unjustified and unwinnable war in Ukraine?

item.title: American unity on Ukraine may be fleeting
item.description: In our era of political polarization, hardly anything can unite a majority of Americans. That's why new polling from CNN on the crisis in Ukraine is so encouraging: 84% of both Democrats and Republicans support increased economic sanctions against Russia. A remarkable 65% of Republicans and 64% of Democrats think we should be doing more to support the Ukrainians.

item.title: How 'Euphoria' depicts drug use isn't 'problematic'
item.description: Note: This op-ed contains mild spoilers for HBO's "Euphoria." HBO and CNN share a parent company.

item.title: A disarmingly genuine portrait of middle America
item.description: Please note: Spoilers follow for the season finale of "Somebody Somewhere."

item.title: Waiter, banker, financial analyst: the new faces of Ukrainian defense and resistance
Student loans weighing you down? Make a plan and face them head-on
Pets are more than great friends, they're good for your health
$2299 & up -- Discover Portugal & Spain in April
